1.description:
This interactive tutorial will get you well on the way to fluency in AsciiDoc, a more robust and better specified alternative to Markdown. The basics of the syntax are almost exactly the same as Markdown, but you'll quickly see how much more powerful AsciiDoc is.

Just as in Markdown, AsciiDoc paragraphs are blocks of text separated by at least one blank line. Type AsciiDoc in the gray box and try to match the target output.

2.description: Make a whole word or phrase bold by surrounding it with asterisks. Make letters within a word bold by surrounding them with double asterisks.

3.description: The syntax for italic text in AsciiDoc follows the model of bold text, except using underscores instead of asterisks. Make a whole word or phrase italic by surrounding it with single underscores. Make letters within a word italic by surrounding them with double underscores.

4.description: Can you guess how to do this one? Double up on asterisks and underscores, and if you're not sure which to put first, remember that we don't say "italic bold."

5.description: Make a word or part of a word superscript by surrounding it with carets.

6.description: Make a word or part of a word superscript by surrounding it with carets.
